definition: to look after/to take care of/to watch/to guard
to see/to look at/to read/to watch/to visit/to call on/to consider/to regard as/to look after/to treat (an illness)/to depend on/to feel (that)/(after verb) to give it a try/Watch out! (for a danger)

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

sentences.english: The butler turned and hurried into the house, slamming the door behind him.
sentences.chinese: 看門人拔腳朝屋裏跑去，門在他身後砰的一聲關上了。

sentences.english: As she was wonderful- she married a door-keeper coming from the country.
sentences.chinese: 由於她是個“騷貨”，下嫁給一個墟落來的看門人。

sentences.english: “He was a janitor in a bowling alley, ” Haggis told me.
sentences.chinese: “他是一個保齡球館看門人，”哈吉斯告訴我。

sentences.english: If you mention my name to the door-keeper he will let you in.
sentences.chinese: 你要是對看門人提我的名字，他會放你進去的。

sentences.english: The old caretaker was always scolding and chiding.
sentences.chinese: 這個老看門人總是責罵，呵叱個沒完。

sentences.english: The porter distributes incoming letters to the offices.
sentences.chinese: 看門人向各個辦公室分發來信。

sentences.english: The watchman just laughs at these stories.
sentences.chinese: 看門人尤里則對這些故事嗤之以鼻。

sentences.english: He fairly hustled around to the side entrance, and was let in by the friendly door-keeper.
sentences.chinese: 他急急繞到側門，友好的看門人放他進了後臺。

sentences.english: The janitor gets to explain why something went wrong.
sentences.chinese: 看門人需要解釋爲什麼事情錯了。

sentences.english: The interpreter accosted one old porter, and asked him if it were far to the Kremlin.
sentences.chinese: 翻譯官向一個年老的看門人詢問克里姆林還有多遠？

sentences.english: He had an illusion when he entered the hotel that the gatekeeper was a detective.
sentences.chinese: 他進旅店時有一種幻覺，認爲看門人是一個偵探。

sentences.english: However, one of our janitors has disappeared.
sentences.chinese: 但是，有一個看門人不見了。

sentences.english: He fairly hustled around to the side entrance and was let in by the friendly door-keeper .
sentences.chinese: 他急急繞到側門，友好的看門人放他進了後臺。

sentences.english: The gateman was a stodgy fellow of60.
sentences.chinese: 看門人是個六十歲的矮胖子。

sentences.english: If the superintendents had caught sight of them, they would have driven such rags forth.
sentences.chinese: 如果看門人發現了他們，一定要攆走這些小化子。

sentences.english: Then he went down stairs and woke up the porter.
sentences.chinese: 他隨即走下樓去，叫醒那看門人。
